dances.name: Jaguar Dance
dances.description: A ritual that symbolizes the strength and indomitable spirit of nature.

details.story: Performed during patron saint festivals, this dance invokes the power of the jaguar, guardian of the jungle and symbol of power in pre-Hispanic cultures. Dancers mimic its movements with captivating energy.

elements.title: Attire
elements.text: Carved wooden masks and costumes simulating jaguar skin.

elements.title: Music
elements.text: Drum and flute rhythms marking feline steps.

elements.title: Symbolism
elements.text: Connection with earth, strength, and the cycle of life.

dances.name: Feather Dance
dances.description: Dazzles with its ceremonial attire and elegant movements.

details.story: Narrates the history of conquest from a local perspective. Despite its beauty, it's a dance with deep historical and cultural resistance meaning. The large feathered headdress is its most distinctive feature.

elements.title: Attire
elements.text: Impressive macaw feather headdresses and mirrors.

elements.title: Movement
elements.text: Spins and jumps requiring great physical skill.

elements.title: Symbolism
elements.text: Historical memory, duality, and cultural syncretism.

dances.name: Deer Dance
dances.description: Honors the spiritual connection between humans and the animal world.

details.story: This dance dramatizes the deer hunt, a sacred animal. It is a rite of gratitude to nature for its sustenance, showing respect for the life that is taken.

elements.title: Attire
elements.text: Headdresses simulating deer antlers and ten치bari rattles.

elements.title: Movement
elements.text: Agile and stealthy steps imitating the animal in nature.

elements.title: Symbolism
elements.text: Respect for nature, the cycle of life and death.
